thig16.1:1.2: of king Koñca and his main queen-consort,
thig16.1:1.4: gladdened by those complying with the Teaching.
thig16.1:2.1: Virtuous, one who speaks her mind,
thig16.1:2.2: very learned and trained in the Teaching of the Buddha.
thig16.1:3.2: as going to any state of existence even divine is non-eternal.
thig16.1:3.4: they bring little enjoyment, and much distress.
thig16.1:4.1: Sensual pleasures are bitter like snake-poison
thig16.1:4.3: For a long time in the Niraya hell, you,
thig16.1:4.4: are handed over, being injured and in pain.
thig16.1:5.1: They sorrow, those who have done evil deeds,
thig16.1:5.2: in hell, they are constantly doing more evil deeds,
thig16.1:6.2: not intending to stop the arising of suffering,
thig16.1:6.4: they do not recognize the Noble Truths.
thig16.1:7.1: Mother, the truths superbly taught by the Buddha,
thig16.1:7.2: those who do not understand them are many more.
thig16.1:7.3: They are delighted with states of existence,
thig16.1:7.4: they long for rebirth as Devas.
